slides.title: What is Paleontology?
slides.content:
# Ancient Life ü¶ï

Study of life prior to the Holocene Epoch (11,700 years ago).
- Uses **Fossils** to understand evolution and interaction with ancient environments.

slides.title: Fossilization
slides.content:
# Getting Stoned ü¶¥

Rare process.
1. Death.
2. Rapid burial (sediment).
3. Permineralization: Minerals replace organic tissue.
4. Erosion exposes it millions of years later.

slides.title: Dating Methods
slides.content:
# Time Clocks üï∞Ô∏è

- **Relative Dating**: Stratigraphy (Lower layers are older).
- **Absolute Dating**: Radiometric ($C^{14}$ for recent, Uranium-Lead for old rocks).
- Allows us to build the Geologic Time Scale.

slides.title: Precambrian Life
slides.content:
# The Beginning ü¶†

- First life: 3.5+ Billion years ago (Cyanobacteria - Stromatolites).
- Great Oxidation Event: Oxygen killed anaerobic life.
- Ediacaran Fauna: First soft-bodied multicellular animals.

slides.title: Cambrian Explosion
slides.content:
# Life Booms üí•

~540 MYA.
Rapid appearance of most major animal body plans.
- Hard shells appeared (Trilobites).
- Eyes evolved.
- Predation started.

slides.title: The Big 5 Extinctions
slides.content:
# Mass Death ‚ò†Ô∏è

1. Ordovician-Silurian
2. Late Devonian
3. **Permian-Triassic** (The Great Dying - 96% marine species lost).
4. Triassic-Jurassic
5. **Cretaceous-Paleogene** (Dinosaurs gone).

slides.title: Epoch Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which extinction event killed the non-avian dinosaurs?

slides.title: Dinosaurs
slides.content:
# Terrible Lizards ü¶ñ

Dominated Mesozoic Era (Triassic, Jurassic, Cretaceous).
- **Saurischian**: Lizard-hipped (T-Rex, Sauropods).
- **Ornithischian**: Bird-hipped (Triceratops, Stegosaurus).
Ironically, birds evolved from Lizard-hipped ones.

slides.title: Feathered Dinosaurs
slides.content:
# Birds are dinos üê¶

Archaeopteryx (1861) was the link.
- Many theropods (Raptors) had feathers.
- Feathers evolved for insulation/display *before* flight.
- Modern birds ARE dinosaurs.

slides.title: Marine Reptiles
slides.content:
# Sea Monsters üêç

NOT Dinosaurs.
- **Ichthyosaurs**: Looked like dolphins.
- **Plesiosaurs**: Long necks (Loch Ness style).
- **Mosasaurs**: Giant lizards (Jurassic World).

slides.title: Pterosaurs
slides.content:
# Flying Reptiles ü¶á

NOT Dinosaurs.
- First vertebrates to fly.
- Ranged from sparrow-size to giraffe-size (Quetzalcoatlus).
- Wing made of skin membrane.

slides.title: Mammal Evolution
slides.content:
# Furry Survivors üê≠

- Evolved alongside dinosaurs (small, nocturnal).
- After K-Pg extinction, they exploded in diversity.
- Whales evolved from land mammals walking back into sea.

slides.title: Human Evolution
slides.content:
# Hominids üö∂

- **Australopithecus** (Lucy): Bipedal apes.
- **Homo habilis**: Tool users.
- **Homo erectus**: Fire, spread out of Africa.
- **Neanderthals**: Cousins in Europe.
- **Homo sapiens**: Us (~300k years ago).

slides.title: Human Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which hominid is famous for being the first to use stone tools?

slides.title: Paleoclimate
slides.content:
# Ancient Weather üå°Ô∏è

- Earth has historically been much hotter (No ice caps).
- **Ice Ages**: Periodic cooling.
- Proxies: Ice cores, tree rings, pollen.

slides.title: Taphonomy
slides.content:
# Grave Laws ‚ö∞Ô∏è

Study of decaying organisms over time regarding how they become fossilized.
- Scavenging, scattering, weathering.
- Helps distinguish biology from geology.

slides.title: Amber
slides.content:
# Tree Sap Wonder ü¶ü

Fossilized tree resin.
- Traps insects/small lizards perfectly in 3D.
- Used in Jurassic Park premise (extracting DNA - not actually possible yet due to DNA degradation).

slides.title: Living Fossils
slides.content:
# Still Here üêü

Species unchanged for millions of years.
- Coelacanth (Thought extinct 66MYA, found 1938).
- Horseshoe Crab.
- Ginkgo Tree.

slides.title: Paleo Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Life evolves and goes extinct.
- **Dinosaurs** ruled for 150M years.
- **Mass Extinctions** reset the stage.
- We are the result of billions of years of survival.
